description: Microsoft 3D Movie Maker was published as part of the Microsoft Kids product line. It allowed children (and others) to create animated 3D movies, complete with 3D characters and environments, animations, sound effects, music, dialogue, and special effects.

Early versions of 3D Movie Maker saved users' animation projects as VMM files. Later versions saved projects in the universal 3MM format, used by both 3D Movie Maker and its offshoot, Nickelodeon 3D Movie Maker.
